title: Underworld
subtitle: /Transmutations
review: When I reviewed {Underworld} (2003) I mentioned the band with the same name, mostly because the movie sucked and I didn't have anything else to say. It turns out the band really was named after a horror movie, this one! Unfortunately this also sucks. There was a bar in Reading that had an old CRT TV in a fireplace, forever showing wonky old VHS B movies and cult classics, muted in lieu of the music they played. The best thing I can say about this is that it has the right vibes for that fireplace: low budget but ambitious filmmaking, and something to look at without actually following. I watched it with the sound on and that was a mistake. The dialogue, and reading of each line, was atrocious. I was glad when it ended.
